qas.question: What people make up the majority of Pashupatinath followers?
In what part of India do the Pashupatinath priests originate?
What dynasty did Yaksha Malla belong to?
Who supposedly encouraged the usage of Karnataka Brahmin priests at Pashupatinath Temple?
What is another term for Bharatam?

context: Believers in Pashupatinath (mainly <a0_0>Hindus<a0_0/>) are allowed to enter the temple premises, but non-Hindu visitors are allowed to view the temple only from the across the Bagmati River. The priests who perform the services at this temple have been Brahmins from Karnataka, <a1_0>South<a1_0/> India since the time of <a2_0>Malla<a2_0/> king Yaksha Malla. This tradition is believed to have been started at the request of <a3_0>Adi Shankaracharya<a3_0/> who sought to unify the states of Bharatam (<a4_0>Unified India<a4_0/>) by encouraging cultural exchange. This procedure is followed in other temples around India, which were sanctified by Adi Shankaracharya.
